name: 量化研究方法
description: This course aims at equipping students with the skills to use quantitative research methods that are adopted in educational research. The teaching contents include the data collection methods, survey research, experimental research, quasi-experimental research, design-based research, etc. Additionally, related research papers will be discussed to increase students’ understanding about the implementation of the introduced research methods in empirical studies.
goals: Develop students’ ability to read articles related to research design in research on digital Chinese language teaching and learning
Enhance students’ ability to conduct research in digital Chinese language teaching through technologies
syllabus:
【授課方式：16+2週】

Week 1 (09/01)：Introduction

Week 2 (09/08)：The nature of educational research

Week3 (09/15)：Theresearch process: From proposal to final report

Week 4 (09/22)：Statistical techniques

Week 5 (09/29)：Selecting a sample

Week 6 (10/06)：Collecting research datawith tests and self-report measures

Week 7 (10/13)：Collecting research datawith questionnaire and interviews

Week 8 (10/20)：Collectingresearch data with observation and content analysis

Week 9 (10/27)：Nonexperimental research:Descriptive and causal-comparative designs

Week 10(11/03)：Nonexperimental research:Correlational designs

Week 11(11/10)：Experimental research:Designs, Part 1

Week 12(11/17)：Experimental research:Designs, Part 2

Week 13(11/24)：Experimentalresearch: Designs, Part 3

Week 14(12/01)：Action research

Week 15(12/08)：Design-based research design

Week 16(12/15)：Evaluation research

Week 17(12/22)：SeminarTalks Participation I

Week 18(12/29)：Seminar Talks Participation II

methodologies.note: To introduce the rationale of educational research and research designs
To divide students in small groups of 4 or 5 and proceed small group discussions on the implementation of different research designs in empirical research
To have students present their discussion results

grading.note: Students should actively engage in in-class discussion and participate in the learning activities led by the instructor.
Each group should give oral presentations of their group discussion results.
